pageContext.claim: “This new era of cooperation can start with finally confirming the more than 300 highly qualified nominees who are still stuck in the Senate -- some after years of waiting. The Senate has failed to act on these nominations, which is unfair to the nominees and to our country.”
pageContext.analysis: Republicans control the Senate and could confirm any pending nominee with a simple majority. In other words, Trump's pending nominees could be confirmed without Democratic votes. Democrats have tools to delay the process, but they cannot block it, and Trump has been slow to name people to many posts. It's also doubtful that more than 300 people are awaiting confirmation. As of Feb. 14, The Washington Post tracker of 707 key administration positions showed 431 people had been confirmed, 128 were awaiting confirmation, four were announced but had not been formally nominated and 147 positions still had no nominee.
